fast3d.renderables

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.renderables.Rectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable

    public class Rectangle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable
    a simple, not illuminated (but with constant color) rectangle in space
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rectangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Vector3d d)
      constructs a rectangle with the given edges and the color white
      Rectangle(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Vector3d c, Vector3d d, Color color)
      constructs a rectangle with the given edges

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3d calculatePunctureWithLine(Vector3d lineOrig, Vector3d lineDir)
      calculates the point that is on both this and the given line
      the lines length is the length of its direction-vector
      the given ray is mathematically restricted with the length-coefficient of the direction-vector in the interval [0.0d,1.0d]
      Rectangle clone() 
      boolean collides(Rectangle t)
      two rectangles collide if they are not the same one and one side of the parameter triangle has a puncture point with this
      boolean contains(Vector3d v) 
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      Vector3d getCenter() 
      Color getColor() 
      Vector3d getDiagon13() 
      Vector3d getDiagon24() 
      Vector3d getEdge1()
      should be the upper left corner
      Vector3d getEdge2()
      should be the upper right corner
      Vector3d getEdge3()
      should be the lower right corner
      Vector3d getEdge4()
      should be the lower left corner
      Vector3d getHeight() 
      Vector3d getNormal() 
      Plate getPlate123() 
      Plate getPlate124() 
      Plate getPlate134() 
      Plate getPlate312() 
      Plate getPlate314() 
      Plate getPlate324() 
      Vector3d getPos()
      should not return null
      should return a reference (should not must)
      Vector3d getSide12() 
      Vector3d getSide23() 
      Vector3d getSide34() 
      Vector3d getSide41() 
      Vector3d[] getVertices()
      should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
      a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
      may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
      Vector3d getWidth() 
      void lookInDirection(Vector3d dir)
      aligns the direction as new normal
      lookInDirection calculates a rotation, the rotation-axis will be the crossProduct of currentNormal and newNormal (== given direction)
      void moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      multiple rectangles can share their edges so that on movement of those rectangles every edge only has to be moved once
      void moveTo(Vector3d target)
      moves the rectangle so that it's center will be at the target but holds it orientation
      Vector3d nadirVector3d(Vector3d point)
      calculates the nadir point of the given point to this plate
      the nadir point is that point on the plate that is shortest from the given point
      the nadir point has not to be on the plate necessarily - in particular: contains(nadir point) does not need to return true
      Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig, Vector3d rayDir)
      for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
      may return null
      void render(Graphics3d g)
      called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
      void rot(Vector3d axis, double rad)
      rotates the rectangle around the given axis
      void rotX(double rad)
      rotates the line around the constant x axis
      void rotY(double rad)
      rotates the line around the constant y axis
      void rotZ(double rad)
      rotates the line around the constant z axis
      void shade(Graphics3d s)
      called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
      the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
      during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
      java.lang.String toString()

        getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        public Vector3d[] getVertices()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
        a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
        may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
        Specified by:
        getVertices in interface Renderable
        Returns:
        the four edges of the rectangle

      • getPos

        public Vector3d getPos()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        should not return null
        should return a reference (should not must)
        Specified by:
        getPos in interface Renderable
        Returns:
        the center-position of the renderable used to determine when the render-call should be done between call of other renderables in the universe to not hide this one behind some renderable actually behind it

      • getCenter

        public Vector3d getCenter()
        Returns:
        getPos();
        See Also:

      • shade

        public void shade(Graphics3d s)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
        the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
        during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
        Specified by:
        shade in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        s - the 3d-graphics-context to do calculations, not null

      • render

        public void render(Graphics3d g)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        g - the 3d-graphics-context to do drawings, not null

      • rayTrace

        public Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d rayOrig,
                         Vector3d rayDir)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
        may return null
        Specified by:
        rayTrace in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        rayOrig - the start-point of the ray
        rayDir - the direction-vector of the ray
        Returns:
        the puncture-point with the ray

      • calculatePunctureWithLine

        public Vector3d calculatePunctureWithLine(Vector3d lineOrig,
                                          Vector3d lineDir)
        calculates the point that is on both this and the given line
        the lines length is the length of its direction-vector
        the given ray is mathematically restricted with the length-coefficient of the direction-vector in the interval [0.0d,1.0d]
        Parameters:
        lineOrig - the start-point of the ray to puncture this
        lineDir - the direction of the ray to puncture this
        Returns:
        the puncture-point of the ray to this, null if the ray does not puncture this

      • clone

        public Rectangle clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        an independent version of this with cloned edges and color

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if the given rectangle has the same color and same edges which can be flipped (edge1 may be edge2 and vice versa)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getNormal

        public Vector3d getNormal()
        Returns:
        a vector that is orthogonal to the rectangle

        public void rotX(double rad)
        rotates the line around the constant x axis
        Parameters:

      • rot

        public void rot(Vector3d axis,
                double rad)
        rotates the rectangle around the given axis
        Parameters:
        axis - the axe to rotate around in mathematically positive direction
        rad - the angle to rotate mathematically positive in radiant

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Vector3d target)
        moves the rectangle so that it's center will be at the target but holds it orientation
        Parameters:
        target - the new rectangle's center

      • moveInAbsoluteDirection

        public void moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
        multiple rectangles can share their edges so that on movement of those rectangles every edge only has to be moved once
        Parameters:
        dir - the movements delta-vector

      • lookInDirection

        public void lookInDirection(Vector3d dir)
        aligns the direction as new normal
        lookInDirection calculates a rotation, the rotation-axis will be the crossProduct of currentNormal and newNormal (== given direction)
        Parameters:
        dir - the new triangles normal-vector

      • collides

        public boolean collides(Rectangle t)
        two rectangles collide if they are not the same one and one side of the parameter triangle has a puncture point with this
        Parameters:
        t - the rectangle to check collision with
        Returns:
        true if any side of the parameter has a puncture-point with this

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Vector3d v)
        Parameters:
        v - the point to test
        Returns:
        whether the point is within this rectangle

      • nadirVector3d

        public Vector3d nadirVector3d(Vector3d point)
        calculates the nadir point of the given point to this plate
        the nadir point is that point on the plate that is shortest from the given point
        the nadir point has not to be on the plate necessarily - in particular: contains(nadir point) does not need to return true
        Parameters:
        point - the point to calculate the nadir point from
        Returns:
        the nadir point on this plate/rectangle from the given point

      • getPlate123

        public Plate getPlate123()
        Returns:
        the plate over the edges 1,2,3

        public Plate getPlate312()
        Returns:
